name: 3dinfo
author: AFNI Developers
description: Prints out sort-of-useful information from a 3D dataset's header

inputs.description: Datasets to retrieve information from
inputs.name: Dataset

inputs.description: Print out lots of information
inputs.name: Verbose

inputs.description: Print out even more information including slice time offsets
inputs.name: Very Verbose

inputs.description: Print out orientation information
inputs.name: Orientation

inputs.description: Print out less information (default)
inputs.name: Short

inputs.description: Omit the HISTORY text
inputs.name: No History

inputs.description: Mini help
inputs.name: Help

inputs.description: Display entire help output
inputs.name: Full Help

inputs.description: Extreme help
inputs.name: Extreme Help

inputs.description: Open help in text editor
inputs.name: Help View

inputs.description: Open help in web browser
inputs.name: Help Web

inputs.description: Look for lines in help output that match WORD
inputs.name: Help Find

inputs.description: Display unedited help string
inputs.name: Help Raw

inputs.description: Help string in sphinx format without autoformatting options
inputs.name: Help SPX

inputs.description: Help string in sphinx format with autoformatting options
inputs.name: Help ASPX

inputs.description: Try to identify all options for the program from the help output
inputs.name: All Options

inputs.description: Output index corresponding to label
inputs.name: Label to Index

inputs.description: Output entire NIML-formatted header
inputs.name: NIML Header

inputs.description: Output only sub-brick part of information
inputs.name: Sub-brick Info

inputs.description: 1 if dset is loadable, 0 otherwise. This works on prefix also.
inputs.name: Exists

inputs.description: Idcodestring of dset
inputs.name: ID

inputs.description: 1 if dset is an atlas.
inputs.name: Is Atlas

inputs.description: 1 if dset has an atlas or labeltable.
inputs.name: Is Atlas or Labeltable

inputs.description: 1 if dset is NIFTI format, 0 otherwise
inputs.name: Is NIFTI

inputs.description: Show filename extension for valid dataset (e.g. .nii.gz)
inputs.name: Dataset Extension

inputs.description: Show internal storage mode of dataset (e.g. NIFTI)
inputs.name: Storage Mode

inputs.description: Dataset's space
inputs.name: Space

inputs.description: Dataset's generic space
inputs.name: Generic Space

inputs.description: AFNI format's view extension for the space
inputs.name: AFNI View Space

inputs.description: What AFNI would use for an output NIFTI (q)sform_code
inputs.name: NIFTI Code

inputs.description: 1 if dset is oblique
inputs.name: Is Oblique

inputs.description: L if orientation is Left handed, R if it is right handed
inputs.name: Handedness

inputs.description: Angle from plumb direction. Angles of 0 (or close) are for cardinal orientations
inputs.name: Obliquity

inputs.description: Return the prefix
inputs.name: Prefix

inputs.description: Return the prefix without extensions
inputs.name: Prefix No Extension

inputs.description: Return the number of voxels in i dimension
inputs.name: Number of Voxels in i

inputs.description: Return the number of voxels in j dimension
inputs.name: Number of Voxels in j

inputs.description: Return the number of voxels in k dimension
inputs.name: Number of Voxels in k

inputs.description: Return ni*nj*nk
inputs.name: Number of Voxels in i*j*k

inputs.description: Return number of points in time or the number of sub-bricks
inputs.name: Number of Points in Time

inputs.description: Same as -nv
inputs.name: Number of Points in Time (Alias)

inputs.description: Same as -ni -nj -nk -nv
inputs.name: Number of Voxels in i*j*k and Points in Time

inputs.description: The maximum sub-brick index (= nv -1 )
inputs.name: Maximum Sub-brick Index

inputs.description: Same as -nvi
inputs.name: Maximum Sub-brick Index (Alias)

inputs.description: Return number of sub-bricks points in time. This is an option for debugging use, stay away from it.
inputs.name: Number of Sub-bricks Points in Time

inputs.description: For a surface-based dset, return the maximum node index
inputs.name: Maximum Node Index

inputs.description: Signed displacement per voxel along i direction, aka dx
inputs.name: Displacement in i

inputs.description: Signed displacement per voxel along j direction, aka dy
inputs.name: Displacement in j

inputs.description: Signed displacement per voxel along k direction, aka dz
inputs.name: Displacement in k

inputs.description: Same as -di -dj -dk
inputs.name: Displacement in i, j, k

inputs.description: Voxel size along i direction (abs(di))
inputs.name: Voxel Size in i

inputs.description: Voxel size along j direction (abs(dj))
inputs.name: Voxel Size in j

inputs.description: Voxel size along k direction (abs(dk))
inputs.name: Voxel Size in k

inputs.description: Same as -adi -adj -adk
inputs.name: Voxel Size in i, j, k

inputs.description: Voxel volume in cubic millimeters
inputs.name: Voxel Volume

inputs.description: Volume origin along the i direction
inputs.name: Origin in i

inputs.description: Volume origin along the j direction
inputs.name: Origin in j

inputs.description: Volume origin along the k direction
inputs.name: Origin in k

inputs.description: Same as -oi -oj -ok
inputs.name: Origin in i, j, k

inputs.description: Volumetric center in x direction (DICOM coordinates)
inputs.name: Center in x

inputs.description: Volumetric center in y direction (DICOM coordinates)
inputs.name: Center in y

inputs.description: Volumetric center in z direction (DICOM coordinates)
inputs.name: Center in z

inputs.description: Same as -dcx -dcy -dcz
inputs.name: Center in x, y, z

inputs.description: The TR value in seconds.
inputs.name: TR Value

inputs.description: The dataset's minimum value, scaled by fac
inputs.name: Minimum Value (Scaled)

inputs.description: The dataset's maximum value, scaled by fac
inputs.name: Maximum Value (Scaled)

inputs.description: The dataset's minimum value, unscaled.
inputs.name: Minimum Value (Unscaled)

inputs.description: The dataset's maximum value, unscaled.
inputs.name: Maximum Value (Unscaled)

inputs.description: Dset storage mode string.
inputs.name: Storage Mode String

inputs.description: Value of dset structure (sub)field 'header_name'
inputs.name: Header Name

inputs.description: Value of dset structure (sub)field 'brick_name'
inputs.name: Brick Name

inputs.description: Name of dset as input on the command line
inputs.name: Input Name

inputs.description: Value of orientation string. For example, LPI means: i direction grows from Left(negative) to Right(positive). j direction grows from Posterior (neg.) to Anterior (pos.) k direction grows from Inferior (neg.) to Superior (pos.)
inputs.name: Orientation

inputs.description: The spatial extent of the dataset along R, L, A, P, I and S
inputs.name: Spatial Extent

inputs.description: Extent along R
inputs.name: Extent along R

inputs.description: Extent along L
inputs.name: Extent along L

inputs.description: Extent along A
inputs.name: Extent along A

inputs.description: Extent along P
inputs.name: Extent along P

inputs.description: Extent along I
inputs.name: Extent along I

inputs.description: Extent along S
inputs.name: Extent along S

inputs.description: Value of various dset structures handling filenames
inputs.name: All Names

inputs.description: Return the float scaling factor
inputs.name: Float Scaling Factor

inputs.description: The label of each sub-brick
inputs.name: Sub-brick Label

inputs.description: The data storage type
inputs.name: Data Storage Type

inputs.description: The minimum value, scaled by fac
inputs.name: Minimum Value (Scaled)

inputs.description: The maximum value, scaled by fac
inputs.name: Maximum Value (Scaled)

inputs.description: The minimum value, unscaled
inputs.name: Minimum Value (Unscaled)

inputs.description: The maximum value, unscaled
inputs.name: Maximum Value (Unscaled)

inputs.description: Show label table, if any
inputs.name: Label Table

inputs.description: Show label table in atlas point format
inputs.name: Label Table as Atlas Points

inputs.description: Show atlas points list, if any
inputs.name: Atlas Points

inputs.description: History note
inputs.name: History Note

inputs.description: Show slice timing
inputs.name: Slice Timing

inputs.description: Output as the first line the names of attributes in each field (column)
inputs.name: Header Line

inputs.description: Same as -header_line
inputs.name: Header Line

inputs.description: Delimiter string between sub-brick values. Default SB_DELIM is '|'
inputs.name: Sub-brick Delimiter

inputs.description: String to use when a field is not found or not applicable. Default is 'NA'
inputs.name: NA Flag

inputs.description: Delimiter string between attributes. Default ATR_DELIM is the tab character
inputs.name: Attribute Delimiter

inputs.description: Display full 3x4 'aform_real' matrix (AFNI's RAI equivalent of the sform matrix in NIFTI, may contain obliquity info), with comment line first
inputs.name: Aform Real Matrix

inputs.description: Display full 'aform_real' matrix (see '-aform_real') as 1 row of 12 numbers. No additional comment
inputs.name: Aform Real Matrix (One Line)

inputs.description: Display full 3x4 'aform_real' matrix (see '-aform_real') *if* the dset were reoriented (via 3drefit) to new orient XXX. Includes comment line first
inputs.name: Aform Real Matrix (Refit Orientation)

inputs.description: If true, aform_real == aform_orth, which should be a very common occurrence
inputs.name: Is Aform Real Orthogonal

inputs.description: Display full 3x4 'aform_orth' matrix (AFNI's RAI matrix equivalent of the NIFTI quaternion, which may contain obliquity info), with comment line first. This matrix is the orthogonalized form of aform_real, and very often AFNI-produced dsets, we will have: aform_orth == aform_real
inputs.name: Aform Orthogonal Matrix

inputs.description: Display 3x3 permutation matrix to go from the dset's current orientation to the YYY orient
inputs.name: Permutation to Orientation

inputs.description: Output 1 if the grid is identical between two dsets, 0 otherwise. For -same_grid to be 1, all of -same_dim, -same_delta, -same_orient, -same_center, and -same_obl must return 1
inputs.name: Same Grid

inputs.description: 1 if dimensions (nx, ny, nz) are the same between dset pairs
inputs.name: Same Dimensions

inputs.description: 1 if voxel sizes are the same between dset pairs
inputs.name: Same Voxel Sizes

inputs.description: 1 if orientation is the same between dset pairs
inputs.name: Same Orientation

inputs.description: 1 if geometric center is the same between dset pairs
inputs.name: Same Geometric Center

inputs.description: 1 if obliquity is the same between dset pairs
inputs.name: Same Obliquity

inputs.description: Equivalent to listing all of -same_dim, -same_delta, -same_orient, -same_center, and -same_obl on the command line
inputs.name: Same All Grid

inputs.description: Output the sum of absolute differences of all voxels in the dataset pair. A -1.0 value indicates a grid mismatch between volume pairs
inputs.name: Value Difference

inputs.description: Same as -val_diff, but the sum is divided (scaled) by the total number of voxels that are not zero in at least one of the two datasets
inputs.name: Scaled Value Difference

inputs.description: Instead of pairing each dset with the first, pair each couple separately. This requires you to have an even number of dsets on the command line
inputs.name: Monogamous Pairs

stdout-output.description: Sort-of-useful information from a 3D dataset's header
